sentences.english: Unless you're privy to divine inspiration, the best thing to do is to watch the process evolve.
sentences.chinese: 除非你知道秘密内情，最好的办法就是静观其变。

sentences.english: I don't think Andrew could have kept that to himself.
sentences.chinese: 我认为不可能只有安德鲁一个人知道内情。

sentences.english: She is a nosey parker and is probably in the know.
sentences.chinese: 她是个爱管闲事的人，可能知道内情的。

sentences.english: The secret to this kind of malicious gossip is not furtiveness.
sentences.chinese: 这种恶毒流言的内情是不会鬼鬼祟祟的。

sentences.english: Employees appreciate being "in the know" and will contribute to improvements and future success.
sentences.chinese: 员工期望知晓决策的内情，有助于进步和未来的成功。

sentences.english: All the more oxygen for the survivors and those in-the-know.
sentences.chinese: 氧气是属于生还者及熟知内情的人。

sentences.english: Does not know inside information, red fruit so very happy.
sentences.chinese: 不知内情的红果于是很高兴的去了。

sentences.english: Murdoch cocoon, lay bare the secret behind revealed cases.
sentences.chinese: 默多克层层剥茧，揭露了案件背后的内情。

definition: inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
sth one wishes to keep secret/ulterior motive/a subject best avoided
behind-the-scenes story/details known only to insiders
variant of 緣由|缘由[yuan2 you2]
cause and effects (idiom); entire process of development

pinyin: xiao1 xi5 ling2 tong1 ren2 shi4

definition: lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
variant of 蒙在鼓裡|蒙在鼓里[meng2 zai4 gu3 li3]
lit. kept inside a drum (idiom)/fig. completely in the dark
